SubTopics: Know and apply the properties of integer exponents to generate equivalent numerical expressions.
Content: Which expression is equivalent to 8⁻⁴ • 8³?

SubTopics: Understand that a function is a rule that assigns to each input exactly one output. The graph of a function is the set of ordered pairs consisting of an input and the corresponding output.
Content: Which sets of ordered pairs represent functions?
Select ALL that apply.

SubTopics: Use square root and cube root symbols to represent solutions to equations of the form x² = p and x³ = p, where p is a positive rational number. Evaluate square roots of small perfect squares and cube roots of small perfect cubes. Know that √2 is irrational.
Content: Consider the following equation.
:ibox:x² = 49/16
Which values are the solutions to the equation?

SubTopics: Use informal arguments to establish facts about the angle sum and exterior angle of triangles, about the angles created when parallel lines are cut by a transversal, and the angle-angle criterion for similarity of triangles.
Content: The following figure shows three lines. Lines m and p are parallel. Angle 1 is labeled. Some of the other seven angles that are labeled in the figure are congruent to angle 1.
problems/MDG8M/media/4a.jpg
Which angles are congruent to angle 1?
Select ALL that apply.

SubTopics: Use rational approximations of irrational numbers to compare the size of irrational numbers by locating them approximately on a number line diagram. Estimate the value of irrational expressions (such as π²).
Content: Which fraction is the best estimate for the value of √(65/122)?

SubTopics: Solve linear equations with rational number coefficients, including equations whose solutions require expanding expressions using the distributive property and collecting like terms.
Content: What value of x satisfies the equation 5(x – 6) – 2(x + 3) = 12?

SubTopics: Know that real numbers that are not rational are called irrational (e.g., π, √2, etc.). Understand informally that every n umber has a decimal expansion; for rational numbers show that the decimal expansion repeats eventually or terminates, and convert a decimal expansion which repeats eventually or terminates into a rational number.
Content: Which of the following numbers are rational?
Select ALL that apply.

SubTopics: Interpret the equation y = mx + b as defining a linear function, whose graph is a straight line; give examples of functions that are not linear.
Content: The equation x + 3y = –3 represents a linear function.
Which graph represents the function?

SubTopics: Use numbers expressed in the form of a single digit times an integer power of 10 to estimate very large or very small quantities, and to express how many times as much one is than the other.
Content: The population of the world is estimated to be 8 × 10⁹. The population of a country is estimated to be 2 × 10⁸.
The world population is about how many times as large as the population of the country?

SubTopics: Lines are taken to lines; line segments to line segments of the same length.
Content: Line segment PQ is the result of reflecting line segment AB across the x–axis. P has coordinates of (2, –2) and Q has coordinates (8, –2).
What is the length of line segment AB?

SubTopics: Understand that solutions to a system of two linear equations in two variables correspond to points of intersection of their graphs, because points of intersection satisfy both equations simultaneously.
Content: The graph of the system of equations {y = 2x + 3, y = x + 5} is shown on the coordinate plane.
problems/MDG8M/media/11a.jpg
What is the solution to the system of equations?

A.Choice: The solution is (2, 7) because the solution to the system must satisfy both equations simultaneously.

B.Choice: The solution is (1, 6) because the solution to the system must satisfy one equation or the other equation.

C.Choice: The solution is (3, 5) because the solution to the system must represent the y-intercepts of both equations.

D.Choice: The solution is (–1.5, –5) because the solution to the system must represent the x-intercepts of both equations.

SubTopics: Know that straight lines are widely used to model relationships between two quantitative variables. For scatter plots that suggest a linear association, informally fit a straight line, and informally assess the model fit by judging the closeness of the data points to the line.
Content: The following scatter plot shows the dollar amount of sales at an ice cream shop for 12 days and the average daily temperature for each of the days.
problems/MDG8M/media/12a.jpg
Which graph shows the scatter plot with the linear model that BEST predicts sales for a given temperature?

SubTopics: Give examples of linear equations in one variable with one solution, infinitely many solutions, or no solutions. Show which of these possibilities is the case by successively transforming the given equation into simpler forms, until an equivalent equation of the form x = a, a = a, or a = b results (where a and b are different numbers).
Content: Consider the equation 2x + 3 = mx + b?
For which values of m and b will the equation have NO solutions?

SubTopics: Describe qualitatively the functional relationship between two quantities by analyzing a graph (e.g., where the function is increasing or decreasing, linear or nonlinear). Sketch a graph that exhibits the qualitative features of a function that has been described verbally.
Content: The graph of a function is shown in the following coordinate plane.
problems/MDG8M/media/14a.jpg
Over which interval does the graph show a constant rate of change?

SubTopics: Solve real-world and mathematical problems leading to two linear equations in two variables.
Content: The amounts that two plumbers charge for their services are described.

:ibox:• The first plumber charges a fixed fee of $40 for house calls and $15 per hour of work.

• The second plumber charges a fixed fee of $30 for house calls and $19 per hour of work.
For what number of hours of work do the first plumber and the second plumber charge the same total amount?

SubTopics: Interpret the equation y = mx + b as defining a linear function, whose graph is a straight line; give examples of functions that are not linear.
Content: Consider the function defined by y = 2x – 5.
Which statements can be used to justify that the function is linear?
Select ALL that apply.

A.Choice: The coefficient of x is greater than 1.

B.Choice: The function has a constant slope of 2.

C.Choice: The function has a negative y–intercept.

D.Choice: The graph of the function is a straight line.

E.Choice: The equation is written in the form y = mx + b.

SubTopics: Understand that solutions to a system of two linear equations in two variables correspond to points of intersection of their graphs, because points of intersection satisfy both equations simultaneously.
Content: A person purchased 10 items to donate to a school, backpacks that cost $25.75 each and notebooks that cost $4.25 each. The total cost of the items is $150. This situation can be represented by a system of equations with a unique solution.
What does the solution to the system of equations represent in this context?

A.Choice: the cost of all the backpacks

B.Choice: the cost of all the notebooks

C.Choice: the total amount of money spent on the items

D.Choice: the number of backpacks and notebooks purchased

SubTopics: Use similar triangles to explain why the slope m is the same between any two distinct points on a non-vertical line in the coordinate plane; derive the equation y = mx for a line through the origin and the equation y = mx + b for a line intercepting the vertical axis at b.
Content: On the following coordinate grid, points N, P, R, and T are collinear. The coordinates of each point are integers. The dashed lines shown on the coordinate grid form triangles MNP and QRT.
problems/MDG8M/media/18a.jpg
Linda claimed that the slope of PR is 6/4 because point P is 6 units to the left of point R and 4 units up from point R.
Explain the error in Linda's claim and calculate the correct slope of PR. Show all of your work.
Use triangles MNP and QRT to show that the slope of the line is the same from point N to point P and from point R to point T.

SubTopics: Apply the Pythagorean Theorem to determine unknown side lengths in right triangles in real-world and mathematical problems in two and three dimensions.
Content: The figure shows the front side of a store sign and its dimensions, in feet. The store owner will paint the entire front side of the sign.
problems/MDG8M/media/19a.jpg
What is the area, in square feet, of the front side of the sign?

SubTopics: Compare properties of two functions each represented in a different way (algebraically, graphically, numerically in tables, or by verbal descriptions).
Content: Certain values of linear function J are shown in the following table, where x is the input variable and y is the output variable.
problems/MDG8M/media/20a.jpg
Linear function K is represented by the equation y = 3x + 8.
Which statements about function J and function K are true?
Select ALL that apply.

A.Choice: The graph of function J has a greater slope.

B.Choice: The graph of function K has a greater slope.

C.Choice: The graph of function J has a greater y-intercept.

D.Choice: The graph of function K has a greater y-intercept.

E.Choice: The graph of function K and the graph of function J have equal slopes.

F.Choice: The graph of function K and the graph of function J have equal y-intercepts.

SubTopics: Use similar triangles to explain why the slope m is the same between any two distinct points on a non-vertical line in the coordinate plane; derive the equation y = mx for a line through the origin and the equation y = mx + b for a line intercepting the vertical axis at b.
Content: Triangle PRT and triangle QRS are shown on the coordinate plane. Points P, Q, and R all lie on the same line, and points T, S, and R all lie on the y-axis. The vertices of both triangles have integer coordinates.
problems/MDG8M/media/21a.jpg
Which statement about the slopes is true?

A.Choice: The slopes of PR and QR are equal because PT/QS = SR/TR.

B.Choice: The slopes of PR and QR are equal because TR/TP = SR/SQ.

C.Choice: The slope of PR is less than the slope of QR because PT/QS < SR/TR.

D.Choice: The slope of PR is greater than the slope of QR because TR/TP > SR/SQ.

SubTopics: Apply the Pythagorean Theorem to determine unknown side lengths in right triangles in real-world and mathematical problems in two and three dimensions.
Content: The following figure shows triangle XYZ. The length of XY is 19 units, and the length of YZ is 181 units.
problems/MDG8M/media/22a.jpg
What is the value of XZ/YZ?

SubTopics: Understand that patterns of association can also be seen in bivariate categorical data by displaying frequencies and relative frequencies in a two-way table. Construct and interpret a two-way table summarizing data on two categorical variables collected from the same subjects. Use relative frequencies calculated for rows or columns to describe possible association between the two variables.
Content: A school had 380 sweatshirts in stock for students to buy. Two colors, green and purple, and two styles, hood and no hood, were available. Of all the sweatshirts, 210 had no hood and 180 were green. Of the sweatshirts that were purple, 70 had a hood.
Which statements about the sweatshirts are true?
Select ALL that apply.

A.Choice: More than half of the sweatshirts had hoods.

B.Choice: More than half of the sweatshirts were purple.

C.Choice: More than half of the green sweatshirts had hoods.

D.Choice: More than half of the sweatshirts without hoods were purple.

E.Choice: More than half of the sweatshirts were green and had a hood.

SubTopics: Solve linear equations with rational number coefficients, including equations whose solutions require expanding expressions using the distributive property and collecting like terms.
Content: Student J and Student K are both reading the same book for a class assignment. Student J reads 20 pages of the book each day. Student K starts reading 2 days after Student J starts reading, and Student K reads 30 pages of the book each day.
Determine the number of days after Student J starts reading when both students will have read the same number of pages of the book. Show your work or explain how you found your answer.

SubTopics: Graph proportional relationships, interpreting the unit rate as the slope of the graph. Compare two different proportional relationships represented in different ways.
Content: A grocery store sells pumpkin seeds and sunflower seeds by the pound.
The equation y = 6x models the relationship between y, the cost, in dollars, and x, the weight, in pounds, of the pumpkin seeds.
The graph shows the relationship between the cost, in dollars, and the weight, in pounds, of the sunflower seeds.
problems/MDG8M/media/25a.jpg
The graph shows the relationship between the cost, in dollars, and the weight, in pounds, of the sunflower seeds.
Which statement is true?

A.Choice: The customer purchased 2 more pounds of sunflower seeds than pumpkin seeds.

B.Choice: The customer purchased 3 more pounds of sunflower seeds than pumpkin seeds.

C.Choice: The customer purchased 2 more pounds of pumpkin seeds than sunflower seeds.

D.Choice: The customer purchased 3 more pounds of pumpkin seeds than sunflower seeds.

SubTopics: Apply the Pythagorean Theorem to determine unknown side lengths in right triangles in real-world and mathematical problems in two and three dimensions.
Apply the Pythagorean Theorem to find the distance between two points in a coordinate system.
Content: The vertices of ∆PQR are P Q (6, 1), (3, 5), and R(11, 11). The length of segment PR is √125 units.
Use the coordinates and geometric reasoning to show that ∆PQR is a right triangle. Explain your reasoning and show your work.

SubTopics: Solve real-world and mathematical problems leading to two linear equations in two variables.
Content: A drama club is selling tickets to a play. The cost of each adult ticket is $8 and the cost of each student ticket is $4. One customer purchased 8 tickets and spent a total of $56.
The system of equations shown can be used to model this situation.

:ibox:y = 8 – x

8x + 4y = 56
Which equation can be used to find x, the number of adult tickets the customer purchased?

SubTopics: Solve systems of two linear equations in two variables algebraically, and estimate solutions by graphing the equations. Solve simple cases by inspection.
Content: Consider the following system of two equations.
What is the value of the expression 3x + 4y?

SubTopics: Know the formulas for the volumes of cones, cylinders, and spheres and use them to solve real-world and mathematical problems.
Content: The dimensions of a circular cylinder are described.

:ibox:• The diameter of the cylinder is 6 meters.

• The height of the cylinder is 12 meters.
What is the volume, in cubic meters, of the cylinder?

SubTopics: Graph proportional relationships, interpreting the unit rate as the slope of the graph. Compare two different proportional relationships represented in different ways.
Content: A group raised money by selling key chains and coffee cups.
In the equation y = 2.75x, the variable y represents the amount, in dollars, that the group raised from selling x key chains.
The following table shows the amount, in dollars, that the group raised from selling coffee cups, based on the number of cups sold on each of four days.
problems/MDG8M/media/30a.jpg
On Friday, the group sells 40 key chains and 40 coffee cups.
What is the total amount raised from selling 40 key chains compared to the total amount raised from selling 40 coffee cups?

A.Choice: It is $2 less than the total amount raised from selling 40 coffee cups.

B.Choice: It is $2 more than the total amount raised from selling 40 coffee cups.

C.Choice: It is $5 less than the total amount raised from selling 40 coffee cups.

D.Choice: It is $5 more than the total amount raised from selling 40 coffee cups.

SubTopics: Use informal arguments to establish facts about the angle sum and exterior angle of triangles, about the angles created when parallel lines are cut by a transversal, and the angle-angle criterion for similarity of triangles.
Content: The figure shows parallel lines h and k intersected by two transversals.
problems/MDG8M/media/31a.jpg
A student claims that the m∠R = 80°.
Which statement about the claim is true?

A.Choice: The claim is incorrect because m∠S = 180° ÷ 3 = 60°, and since ∠R and ∠S are corresponding angles, m∠R = 60°.

B.Choice: The claim is incorrect because m∠S = 60° + 40° = 100°, and since ∠R and ∠S are alternate interior angles, m∠R = 100°.

C.Choice: The claim is correct because m∠S = (360° ÷ 3) 40° = 80°, and since ∠R and ∠S are corresponding angles, m∠R = 80°.

D.Choice: The claim is correct because m∠S = 180° – (40° + 60°) = 80°, and since ∠R and ∠S are alternate interior angles, m∠R = 80°.

SubTopics: Know and apply the properties of integer exponents to generate equivalent numerical expressions.
Content: A teacher has a cube. Each face of the cube has an area of 1/36 square foot.
Let d represent the length, in feet, of each edge of the cube. Write and solve an equation that includes the use of exponents to determine the value of d.
Equation: :FR-1:
Solution: d = :FR-2:
Let v represent the volume, in cubic feet, of the cube. Write an equation (in terms of d) that includes the use of exponents and solve an it to determine the value of v.
Equation: :FR-1:
Solution: v = :FR-2:

SubTopics: Use similar triangles to explain why the slope m is the same between any two distinct points on a non-vertical line in the coordinate plane; derive the equation y = mx for a line through the origin and the equation y = mx + b for a line intercepting the vertical axis at b.
Content: The graph of a line is shown on the coordinate plane.
problems/MDG8M/media/33a.jpg
Which pair of statements describe the correct equation of the line AND give a correct explanation about the ordered pairs on the line?

A.Choice: The equation of the line is y = –7x – 2/7 because the slope of the line is –2/7, and the y-intercept is –7. The coordinates of the ordered pairs on the line always satisfy the equation.

B.Choice: The equation of the line is y = –7x – 7/2 because the slope of the line is –7, and the y-intercept is –7/2. The coordinates of the ordered pairs on the line never satisfy the equation.

C.Choice: The equation of the line is y = –7x/2 + 7 because the slope of the line is –7/2, and the y-intercept is 7. The coordinates of the ordered pairs on the line always satisfy the equation.

D.Choice: The equation of the line is y = –2x/7 + 7 because the slope of the line is 7, and the y-intercept is –2/7. The coordinates of the ordered pairs on the line never satisfy the equation.

SubTopics: Solve real-world and mathematical problems leading to two linear equations in two variables.
Content: A school club ordered medium pizzas and large pizzas for a club meeting. Each medium pizza cost $10 and was shared by 3 students. Each large pizza cost $12 and was shared by 4 students. There are 26 students in the club, and the club spent $80 on the pizzas.
Which system of equations models this situation, where x represents the number of medium pizzas and y represents the number of large pizzas?

SubTopics: Construct a function to model a linear relationship between two quantities. Determine the rate of change and initial value of the function from a description of a relationship or from two (𝑥𝑥, 𝑦𝑦) values, including reading these from a table or from a graph. Interpret the rate of change and initial value of a linear function in terms of the situation it models, and in terms of its graph or a table of values.
Content: Anton has some money saved for school. To increase the amount he has saved, he got a job and added all the money earned to the amount already saved.

:ibox:• Anton was paid a constant rate in dollars per hour at his job.

• After working 10 hours, the amount he had saved was $450.

• After working 20 hours, the amount he had saved was $600.

• Anton did not save any other money or spend any of the money he had saved.
Which equation represents y, the amount of money in dollars Anton would have saved after working x hours?
